author: Sohrab
title: Meet the Characters of Marvel Studiosâ€™ Echo - D23
text: By Courtney Potter Itâ€™s a sure-to-be-thrilling way to kick off the new year... The good folks at Marvel Studios will soon present Echo, spotlighting Maya Lopez as sheâ€™s pursued by Wilson Fiskâ€™s criminal empire. When the journey brings her home, sheâ€™s forced to confront her own family and legacy. Echo stars Alaqua Cox (Hawkeye) as Maya Lopez, as well as Chaske Spencer (Wild Indian, The English), Tantoo Cardinal (Killers of the Flower Moon, Stumptown), Devery Jacobs (FXâ€™s Reservation Dogs, American Gods), Zahn McClarnon (Dark Winds, FXâ€™s Reservation Dogs), and Cody Lightning (Hey, Viktor!, Four Sheets to the Wind)â€”with Graham Greene (1883, Goliath) and Vincent Dâ€™Onofrio (Hawkeye, Daredevil, Law & Order: Criminal Intent), who returns to the villainous role of Wilson Fisk, aka Kingpin. Episodes of the series are directed by Sydney Freeland (Navajo) and Catriona McKenzie (Gunaikurnai); Kevin Feige, Stephen Broussard, Louis Dâ€™Esposito, Brad Winderbaum, Victoria Alonso, Richie Palmer, Jason Gavin (Blackfeet), Marion Dayre, and Sydney Freeland are executive producers, and Jennifer L. Booth and Amy Rardin are co-executive producers. With Echoâ€™s big premiere on Tuesday, January 9, weâ€™re taking a closer look at whoâ€™s who in the highly anticipated series: Maya Lopez (Alaqua Cox) Maya is a force to be reckoned with. Sheâ€™s skilled in martial arts and hand-to-hand combatâ€”and is at home on her motorcycle. When she flees New York City after assassinating the crime boss Kingpin, sheâ€™s forced to reunite with the family she left long ago under tragic circumstances. â€œIn Hawkeye, Maya was a villain,â€ says director Sydney Freeland. â€œAnd while sheâ€™s our protagonist in Echo, we wanted to embrace those darker sides and flaws within the character, who is on an extreme emotional journey trying to navigate the pent-up anger inside her. Sheâ€™s a very nuanced character with culture and ancestry in the Choctaw community, which is something we hadnâ€™t seen before.â€ In addition to the characterâ€™s cultural background, Mayaâ€™s physical prowess underscores her mental toughness and is indicative of her soon-to-be antihero status. Cox left her home on the Menominee Indian Reservation in Keshena, Wisconsin, to join the Hawkeye cast just a few years ago. â€œWhen I jumped into the Marvel world, it was a big transition for me, but I was so grateful for the opportunity and journey,â€ says the actor, who learned about plans for Echo while filming Hawkeye. â€œI felt so overwhelmed and shocked because it was a lead role in my second project, which seemed kind of crazy. I remember telling my family and it just meant so much because it gives Indigenous people a leading character and real representation in an authentic way. It feels amazing to be able to have the opportunity inspire and empower a future generation of people.â€ The actor is intently aware of what the characterâ€™s physicality will mean to others in the amputee community. â€œI wanted to show people that amputees and people with disabilities can do anything,â€ says Cox. â€œAlthough I am deaf and an amputee, I was able to do a lot of my fighting and stuntsâ€”and it was important to me to show my prosthetic leg and not try to hide it under clothes. Maya Lopez is a badass, and I wanted people with disabilities to have someone that they could look up to and see within themselves.â€ Additionally, Coxâ€™s Maya is the second deaf hero to join the MCU, after Lauren Ridloffâ€™s Makkari in Eternals. It was important to filmmakers that the storytelling and approach to production embraced the characterâ€™s preferred way of communicating with others. In fact, many scenes feature no spoken dialogue; the production also provided weekly group learning sessions for the filmmakers and crew to help with the overall communication on set. â€œAll the people on the crew were able to take sign language classes for a few months before we actually started filming, which was really cool,â€ says Cox. Says director Sydney Freeland, â€œAfter studying American Sign Language and talking with [consulting producer and ASL master] Doug Ridloff, one of the things that became apparent was that the hands are an extension of oneâ€™s emotion and expression. The hands are the text, and the face is the subtext, and you need those two things together to get an idea of what a personâ€™s feeling. We built our entire visual language with that in mind.â€ Wilson Fisk, aka Kingpin (Vincent Dâ€™Onofrio) Fisk was once known as â€œUncleâ€ to Maya, who looked up to him after relocating to New York City with her father as a child. Fisk was long ago crowned Kingpin by the NYC criminal underworld. He was rightly feared by allâ€”nobody dared challenge Kingpinâ€”at least not until Maya Lopez discovered that he gave the orders to have her father killed. Their final encounter ended in a gunshot... but Fisk has the kind of power that always seems to eclipse even the grimmest circumstances. â€œI love that Echo is Maya Lopezâ€™s origin story,â€ says the actor. â€œYou get introduced to this Native American world and itâ€™s intense, spiritual, and deeply emotionalâ€”itâ€™s all about her family and ancestors. Kingpin is both a physically and emotionally brutal character. There is a strong layer of a father-daughter thing with Kingpin and Maya. Itâ€™s a great way to bring out all kinds of intensities and emotions and their dynamic has this flavor thatâ€™s completely unique.â€ Henry â€œBlack Crowâ€ Lopez (Chaske Spencer) Henry is Mayaâ€™s well-intended uncle who owns the local roller-skating rink. But Henry has a troubled past that he canâ€™t quite escapeâ€”including ties to Fiskâ€™s criminal underworld. Spencer, who fills Uncle Henryâ€™s shoes, says not only is his character the brother of Mayaâ€™s late father, William, he still has his hands in the very business that led to her fatherâ€™s untimely death. â€œHenry feels guilty about his brotherâ€™s death, and thereâ€™s a lot that Maya brings to the situation that I donâ€™t think Henry is ready to face yet,â€ he explains. Skully (Graham Greene) Wise, funny, and kind-natured, Skully owns the town pawn shop. He is a grandfather figure to Maya, offering his support, warmth, and guidance along the way. Unlike many of her estranged family members, Skully is willing to set aside any differences and move forward with love. â€œWhen Maya was a young child, [Skully] was going out with her grandmother, Chula,â€ says Greene. â€œMaya comes back into his life after she damages her prosthetic leg and wants him to repair it for herâ€”it helps rekindle their relationship.â€ Chula (Tantoo Cardinal) Chula is Mayaâ€™s estranged grandmother. Her overwhelming anger following the tragic loss of her daughter, Mayaâ€™s mother, led to the hasty departure of Maya and her father. Maya, so young and impressionable, shared in Chulaâ€™s griefâ€”but the distance between them has only grown in the years since they last saw each other. For Cardinal, her characterâ€™s maternal instincts are being tested by Maya so many years later. â€œIn the beginning of the series, Maya and Chulaâ€™s relationship is pretty fractured and they are not in a good place,â€ the actress says. â€œMaya comes from strength, but she also comes from a place of confusion.â€ Bonnie (Devery Jacobs) Bonnie is Mayaâ€™s estranged cousin and childhood best friend who works as an EMT in Tamaha, Oklahoma. She and Maya were like sisters as kids, and Bonnie took it hard when Maya left. Sheâ€™d love nothing more than to be close again with Maya. â€œMaya Lopez is so badass, and she goes through the world very guarded,â€ says Jacobs. â€œBut itâ€™s through glimpses of interacting with Bonnie that we really get to see Mayaâ€™s heart and vulnerability.â€ Biscuits (Cody Lightning) Biscuits is Mayaâ€™s well-meaning cousin, who helps her get settled when she returns home to Oklahoma. â€œBiscuits is Mayaâ€™s sidekick, who provides some comic relief for her,â€ says Lightning. â€œHeâ€™s like a big, earnest puppy dogâ€”but heâ€™s very resourceful and always figures out a way to get things done for Maya. Heâ€™s very loyal and will do anything for his family, even if that means getting into some trouble.â€

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Russian-Canadian couple created free app to help Ukrainians in war-torn country
text:
Summary by Ground News Faino is a free psychological support chatbot on Telegram. It provides individuals with on-demand tools to cope with stress, anxiety and emotions. The app has been used by over 53,000 people around the world so far. Mikhail and Vera Kelim say they find inspiration in Canada's welcoming environment. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Prince Albert Daily Herald Russian-Canadian couple created free app to help Ukrainians in war-torn country Javier Ortega-Araiza, Local Journalism Initiative Reporter, New Canadian Media Three years after they had landed in Canada from Russia, Mikhail and Vera Kelimâ€™s lives took a sharp turn. It was on Feb. 24, 2022 that the Russia-Ukraine war began, and having close friends in both places, the Waterloo, Ont.-based couple found themselves in shock. They [â€¦]

author: Ashley Tysiac
title: TCS London Marathon Announces Star-Studded Elite Fields For 2025 - FloTrack
text:
2025 TCS London Marathon
TCS London Marathon Announces Star-Studded Elite Fields For 2025
TCS London Marathon Announces Star-Studded Elite Fields For 2025
Both Olympic champions and some of the fastest men and women in history will compete in the elite fields at the 2025 TCS London Marathon.
TCS London Marathon CEO Hugh Brasher doesn't put it lightly when he says this year's London Marathon field may be the best ever assembled in the event's history.
"This is quite simply the greatest elite field in the history of the London Marathon," said Brasher in a statement.
And the now-released entry lists certainly back up that talk. All Olympic and Paralympic marathon champions from Paris will compete at the 2025 London Marathon, along with the 2024 men's and women's winners and a some of the fastest men and women to ever run the marathon distance.
The event, streaming live on FloTrack on, will take place on April 27.
Subscribe To FloTrack To Watch More Track & Field Meets All Year LongWatch The Diamond League Live On FloTrack, Starting In 2025Olympic Champions Sifan Hassan, Tamirat Tola To Race 2025 London MarathonWorld Record Holder Ruth Chepngetich To Run 2025 London MarathonEmile Cairess Leads British Field For 2025 London Marathon
Headliners already announced on the women's side include Olympic gold medalist Sifan Hassan, world record holder Ruth Chepngetich and reigning London Marathon champion Ruth Chepngetich. Joining them now on the start line is Tigst Assefa, the second-fastest woman in history and previous world record holder behind her 2:11:53 performance at the 2023 Berlin Marathon.
Joyciline Jepkosgei, who won the London Marathon in 2021, and Alemu Megertu, who took home the win at the 2024 Valencia Marathon, will also be among the top contenders in the women's field.
Six women in the field own marathon PRs under 2:17.
On the men's side, competing alongside Olympic champion Tamirat Tola and 2024 London champion Alexander Mutiso is Jacob Kiplimo, who is making his transition to the marathon distance for the first time in his career. Kiplimo has put together a legendary career on the track and cross country course, winning four World Cross Country titles and bronze in the 10,000m at the Tokyo Olympics and 2022 World Championships.
Joining Tola, Mutiso and Kiplimo at the top of the men's field is Sabastian Sawe, who stunned with a 2:02:05 performance at the 2024 Valencia Marathon for a win and the fastest marathon debut in history. Additionally, 2024 Berlin Marathon champion Milkesa Mengesha, 2024 NYC Marathon winner Adbi Nageeye and 2:02:55 marathoner Timothy Kiplagat will be athletes to watch in the loaded men's field.
Top Americans entered for the 2025 London Marathon include Kelvin Salvano on the men's side, who owns a PR of 2:11:26, and Susanna Sullivan, who placed as the top American at the Chicago Marathon last October.

author: jpost.com
title: Israeli artist paints the homes of evacuees forced to flee due to war - Israel Culture
text:
Jordana Golding is a watercolor artist who paints â€œbuilding portraits.â€
Clients come to her, she says, â€œwith photos of buildings that have great significance in their lives, such as the cafÃ© where they went on their first date with their spouse, or their childhood home, or somewhere else, and I paint it in watercolor.â€
Since Oct. 7 , Golding has been reaching out to people from the South and the North who have lost their homes or been displaced.
She wants to get the message across to any of them who would like a painting of their homes. â€œFor those kinds of commissions, I do it free of charge. Obviously, I couldnâ€™t take money for such a thing, and I would just love to reach more people.â€
Golding just wants â€œto help everyone have that memory because it must be so terrible for them,â€ she says. DESTROYED HOUSE (credit: Jordana Golding)
SHE BEGAN painting buildings at age 21, when her parents sold their family home in the UK.
â€œI wanted a picture for me and my family and I love painting, so I went back to London to visit and took photos of the house â€“ and then came home to paint it,â€ she explains.
â€œI painted it, and then my sister-in-law, who is very artistic herself, said: â€˜Great! I want you to do the house I just bought with your brother.â€™ So I did that. And then, through word of mouth, I got more and more commissions. I used my marketing background and started to advertise, and then I got strangers asking me to do buildings of significance to them,â€ she recounts.
â€œAnd then, in the war, it occurred to me that people were losing their homes for the worst reasons possible â€“ not for good reasons such as I am used to, like clients who say â€˜We got married and had to leave our childhood homes,â€™ but for really sad reasons.
â€œAnd I thought: â€˜These people deserve to have that memory framed â€“ a picture of their house as they knew it before it was destroyed.â€™â€
Golding has already completed half a dozen commissions but is averse to sharing pictures of those paintings out of respect for the ownersâ€™ privacy.
They are very personal, she says.
â€œI have done half a dozen for people from the South, mostly Kibbutz Reâ€™im, one in Beâ€™eri, one in Kfar Aza,â€ she says. â€œItâ€™s emotional when you are painting it, knowing that none of that is there anymore, and itâ€™s probably an army base right now. Itâ€™s emotional sending them to the clients, as they havenâ€™t seen their houses in a while and I wish that they could only remember the good memories from it.â€
IN TERMS of technique, Golding first makes a pencil sketch, which she sends to the client to approve. â€œIt can always be fixed at that stage.â€ While she copies exactly from the photos she is given, it can happen that â€œthe images I copy might not be exactly the same as they are in peopleâ€™s memories. The building might look two-dimensional in the photo and then after I draw it â€“ because they see it in their memory, not from the photo â€“ they say, for instance, â€˜Actually, that door looked a bit different...â€™â€
Once they confirm that they like the look of it, she goes ahead.
â€œThen I carry on with the rest of the painting by going over the pencil lines with a black pen and then erasing the pencil, and then going in with watercolor paints and touching up here and there with the black pen.â€
Golding then continues, using very light brush strokes of opaque color (â€œbecause you really canâ€™t move it around too much once the pigmented paints are on the pageâ€) and keeps adding layers â€“ â€œuntil itâ€™s what I want.â€
â€œAll the little bricks that you see,â€ she says, â€œI do them by hand with a tiny brush. I draw the little square and fill it in. I donâ€™t have like a stamp or something.â€
Golding calls International Womenâ€™s Day her favorite day of the year.
â€œI am definitely the biggest feminist I know,â€ she says.
â€œI come from a line of hard-working women who are self-made, with their own businesses â€“ even in generations where it wasnâ€™t so acceptable to be a woman owning her business.â€
Her grandmother, she recounts, was the first woman in England to have a credit card without the need for her husband as a signatory. In those days, if a woman wanted to spend over a certain amount on her card, her husband had to authorize it.
â€œThatâ€™s the kind of stories that I grew up on, and now to be a small business owner on my own is very rewarding,â€ she asserts.
Golding also hails â€œfrom a house of mainly men: brothers, uncles, and my dad, of course.â€
She considers them all â€œa wonderful influence,â€ pointing to her relationship with them as making her more boisterous and tough.
The artist says that Nana, her paternal grandmother, was very artistic, â€œand she passed it on to my dad and on to me.
â€œNana was also a business owner in London all her life with her husband, my grandfather â€“ and so was my mother.â€
Goldingâ€™s mother was a stay-at-home-mom, which her daughter defines as â€œa big job.â€ Later, she â€œdecided she wanted to make some money, and so she went out and did.â€ Golding recently discovered that her mother also liked to paint and â€œwas actually very talented.â€
â€œSo maybe I got it from her, after all,â€ her daughter says with a laugh.
WHILE SHE knows itâ€™s International Womenâ€™s Month , she insists that â€œI donâ€™t want to forget my dad in all this because from a very young age, I was asking him to shlep me to all parts of the country, to take me to art exhibitions, to find the best art equipment and the best place to sell things. I would drive him nuts my whole childhood, and he always encouraged me.
â€œHe was always there to kick me up the backside, saying â€˜You can do that commission, thatâ€™s not above you â€“ you can do that.â€™ He dragged me to all my universities â€“ I got accepted to the London College of Art and to five other universities to study art.â€
Goldingâ€™s parents insisted that she was only allowed to attend a school away from home if she first spent a gap year in Israel.
â€œMy parents insisted on it,â€ she said. â€œThey said that there was a lot of anti-Zionism on campus ; that I had to be prepared and really needed to understand and know how to defend Israel against things like apartheid week, antisemitism and anti-Zionism â€“ which we are now unfortunately seeing a lot of.â€
She came to Israel on a gap year program and fell in love with the country. â€œIt backfired on them,â€ she says, â€œbecause I came back to England after the year and said â€˜I am not staying here: I want to live in Israel â€“ and to live in Israel, I have got to do what all the other people my age are doing, which is to join the IDF.â€™â€
Golding looks back on the past few years with pride. â€œI gave up all those placesâ€ in universities and instead â€œbecame a combat soldier at checkpoints and fought a lot of terror attacks,â€ she said, but â€œalways painted during every five seconds of free time I had.â€ ï€¼ The beating heart of Tel Aviv
Curated by Fiammetta Martegani, â€œThe Beating Art of Tel Avivâ€ exhibition comprises works by Jordana Golding, Tanya Past, and Tamir Yehuda, completed â€œlong before the war began,â€ Golding explains.
Since 2022, â€œThe Art and Soul of Tel Aviv projectâ€ has combined various artists with differing techniques who, together, â€œbecome the storytellers of the city,â€ explains Martegani.
â€œWhat brings them together in their artwork is their love for the White City, the Bauhaus movement, its light, and its vibes,â€ the curator says. â€œLike an orchestra, each uses a different instrument, and all together they play the symphony of this unique place in the world, where the conductor is the city itself.
â€œAfter five editions of this exhibition, October 7 arrived, and we asked ourselves if we could and should put together a new edition, including all the works selected just a few months before the Black Shabbat.â€
As curator, Martegani held many discussions with Hagit Shahar, director of the Drahi Center, â€œabout our next move.â€
â€œI felt so heartbroken, that I suggested changing the title and â€“ at least for this edition â€“ calling it â€œThe Broken Art of Tel Avivâ€ instead of â€œThe Art and Soul of Tel Aviv project.â€
But Shahar responded: â€œWe are not broken, we are beating!â€
â€œThis is how we conceived this new exhibition, â€œThe Beating Art of Tel Avivâ€ explains Martegani, â€œasking each artist to add to their works the feeling of â€˜beating,â€™ to show the resilience of Israel in a time of war. For me, as curator, this is a crucial message to spread during such a difficult time in our lives.
â€œBecause, despite everything, we are still in the middle of a very long journey; we are still beating,â€ she says: â€œLike the heart â€“ and the art â€“ of Tel Aviv.â€
The exhibition is scheduled to run until April 1 at the Sport and Culture Community Center, Kalisher 5, Tel Aviv. For more information, 073-3844151 or kalisher@tel-aviv.gov.il Continuity and hope despite destruction
â€œI did an Instagram post for my clients abroad,â€ Golding said. â€œI took a very beautiful commission of a random picture and I destroyed it, I burnt it and punched a hole in it â€“ and it looked horrifying and it was like: â€˜If this horrifies you, imagine people losing their homes and their life.â€™â€
She posted:
To all my clients outside of Israel, A home is where one is supposed to feel safe. Youâ€™re greeted by familiar voices and the smell of home-cooked meals. You fall asleep with the comfort of knowing that your loved ones are just in the room next door.
This is no longer the case in Israel. Our homes are being bombed. Theyâ€™re being burnt to the ground with families inside. Terrorists broke doors down to have their way with whoever was inside. They graffitied the walls, ripped down curtains, smashed windows, and left bloody footprints. Everywhere.
Thousands of Israelis right now are living out of frantically packed suitcases in unfamiliar environments. Theyâ€™ve had to leave behind family heirlooms, photos, toys, and bodies of relatives because a terrorist organization within our midst saw it fit to destroy everything and everyone in their wake, the elderly and babies included.
A home is so much more than walls and windows, itâ€™s where memories are built and preserved. Nobody should have it taken away from them.
â€œIf you or someone you know has lost a home or a business in this dreadful war and you wish to remember it for how it was before, please be in touch. Iâ€™d like to help you preserve that memory, free of charge. Weâ€™ll get through this. We donâ€™t have a choice. Jordana.
â€œIt was like a â€˜shock-factorâ€™ kind of post for people not living in Israel,â€ Golding said, â€œand the curator, Fiammetta Martegani saw the post and said that the painting of the destroyed house should be in the exhibition â€“ and the exhibition should be about continuity and hope.â€
For more information, see Jordana Goldingâ€™s website: artbyjorderz.weebly.-com

author: Balakrishna
title: "Hey Babar Azam, this isn't Zimbabwe"- Top 10 funny memes from day 1 of 1st Pakistan vs South Africa Test 2024
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Follow Us Share 0 Discuss 0 Discuss What's your opinion? "Hey Babar Azam, this isnâ€™t Zimbabwe"- Top 10 funny memes from day 1 of 1st Pakistan vs South Africa Test 2024 Discuss Now Fans react after day 1 of 1st Test between SA and PAK. (Images: X - ProteasMenCSA, @backup6543, Instagram - worldofcricketmemes_) The two-match Test series between South Africa and Pakistan commenced on Thursday (December 26) at the SuperSport Park in Centurion. The hosts started well on Boxing Day by bundling out Pakistan for 211 and then scored 82 for the loss of three wickets before stumps.
Fans enjoyed the intriguing action that unfolded on the opening day of the first Test between the two teams. They expressed their reactions by sharing memes on Instagram and X (formerly known as Twitter). One of the fans trolled star Pakistan batter Babar Azam, who failed in the first innings, falling for 4 (11) early in the day. The post was captioned:
"Hey Babar Azam, this isnâ€™t Zimbabwe." Expand Tweet Trending Here are a few more memes:
Expand Tweet Expand Tweet Expand Tweet Expand Tweet Expand Tweet South Africa pacers Dane Paterson and Corbin Bosch star with nine wickets to restrict Pakistan to 211 in the 1st Test 2024 South Africa captain Temba Bavuma won the toss and opted to bowl first in the contest. Shan Masood (17) promoted himself to the opening position in the match to accommodate Babar Azam (4) at number three. It did not work out, as both batters departed inside the first session without scoring much. The Proteas pacers gave their side a brilliant start by reducing visitors to 56/4 in 18.3 overs.
Kamran Ghulam (54) hit a counter-attacking half-century and tried to rescue his side. However, Dane Paterson dismissed him at the end of the 38th over to give the hosts a crucial breakthrough. Mohammad Rizwan (27), Agha Salman (18), Aamer Jamal (28), and the lower order batters added some runs in the end to take Pakistan to 211. Dane Paterson picked up a five-wicket haul, while Corbin Bosch scalped four wickets for South Africa in the bowling department.
Khurram Shahzad (2/28) and Mohammad Abbas (1/36) then bowled decently to pick up three wickets with the new ball before the conclusion of the play. Aiden Markram (47*) remained unbeaten at the crease along with Temba Bavuma (4*), with South Africa on 82/3 after 22 overs.

author: Reuters
title: Soccer-Champions Senegal steam into last 16 with 3-1 win over Cameroon | Sports-Games
text: Ismaila Sarr scored one goal and laid on another as defending champions Senegal beat Cameroon 3-1 on Friday and booked their place in the round of 16 at the Africa Cup of Nations, leaving their opponents in some peril. [Reuters](/reuters-stories)| Yamoussoukro | Updated: 20-01-2024 00:34 IST | Created: 20-01-2024 00:34 IST - Country: - Cote d'Ivoire Ismaila Sarr scored one goal and laid on another as defending champions Senegal beat Cameroon 3-1 on Friday and booked their place in the round of 16 at the Africa Cup of Nations, leaving their opponents in some peril. Sarr opened the scoring in the first half of the Group C clash in Yamoussoukro after a mistake by Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana, who was playing his first game of the tournament after a late arrival in the Ivory Coast. Habib Diallo added the second goal from Sarr's cross before Jean-Charles Castelletto scored a late consolation for Cameroon. Sadio Mane completed the scoring for Senegal in injury time. The Lions of Teranga advance to the knockout rounds with a final group game against Guinea to spare. Cameroon must play Gambia in their last match. Both of those are on Tuesday. Senegal head the pool with six points from their two games, while Cameroon and Guinea have a point each and Gambia are yet to break their duck. The latter two sides meet at the same venue later on Friday. ALSO READ [FACTBOX-Soccer-Profile of Equatorial Guinea team for 2023 Africa Cup of Nations](/article/sports-games/2768841-factbox-soccer-profile-of-equatorial-guinea-team-for-2023-africa-cup-of-nations) [FACTBOX-Soccer-Profile of Guinea team for 2023 Africa Cup of Nations](/article/sports-games/2768837-factbox-soccer-profile-of-guinea-team-for-2023-africa-cup-of-nations) [FACTBOX-Soccer-Profile of Guinea Bissau team for 2023 Africa Cup of Nations](/article/sports-games/2768833-factbox-soccer-profile-of-guinea-bissau-team-for-2023-africa-cup-of-nations) [Soccer-Dalot, Fernandes goals put Manchester United into FA Cup fourth round](/article/sports-games/2770038-soccer-dalot-fernandes-goals-put-manchester-united-into-fa-cup-fourth-round) [Soccer-Guinea hope Guirassy injury no blow to Cup of Nations campaign](/article/sports-games/2770423-soccer-guinea-hope-guirassy-injury-no-blow-to-cup-of-nations-campaign)

author: Kelbie Lewis
title: Truck-train collision in Penwell kills 2 | newswest9.com
text:
PENWELL, Texas â€” Two people are confirmed dead after a fiery truck and train collision that happened Wednesday morning in Penwell, according to Texas DPS.
The fatal crash occurred at approximately 9 a.m.
Authorities responded to the crossing of Avenue G where a pickup truck was "struck" by a Union Pacific train and caught fire.
DPS said there was no train derailment and Union Pacific has been notified.
First responders were on the scene of the crash â€” drivers are urged to avoid the area as crews are working to clear the roadway.
The crash is still under investigation and no names have been released at this time.
NewsWest 9 will update the story as more information becomes available.
Close Ad

â€œÂ¿Nobel para Petro? Â¡No jodÃ¡s! Osea, encima de eso, nos vamos a dejar engaÃ±ar por esa cortina de humo frente a la incompetencia, la corrupciÃ³n, los nuevos pliegos de la desastrosa licitaciÃ³n de los pasaportes para robarsela con el canciller Leyvaâ€.

AgregÃ³ que Gustavo Petro estÃ¡ entregando el paÃ­s a la guerrilla y que nunca ha habido voluntad real de paz por parte de ninguno de los actores del proceso que se adelanta en Colombia con algunos grupos armados:
â€œÂ¡No jodÃ¡s! Â¿Ahora nos vamos a dejar distraer en ese debate? No colombianos, Ã©l mientras tanto, le estÃ¡ entregando el paÃ­s al ELN y a las Farc, dos grupos guerrilleros que no tienen ninguna intenciÃ³n de desmovilizarse, ni en lo moral ni en lo material, y que estÃ¡n en plenas operaciones ofensivas. EstÃ¡n copando el territorio con la convivencia de unos comisionados de paz y de una mesa negociadora que sabe a ciencia y paciencia, que el ELN claramente ha dicho que nunca va a cesar su violencia contra el pueblo colombiano. Mientras tanto, Colombia de rodillas, la economÃ­a de rodillas.
Finalmente, Enrique GÃ³mez invitÃ³ a los ciudadanos que se han visto afectados por la violencia y abandono del Estado en los territorios, a interponer recursos legales para que haya mayor justicia.
â€œÂ¿Nobel para Petro? Â¡No jodÃ¡s! Hagamos las acciones de tutela si usted es afectado por el hecho de que han guardado las guarniciones militares y han abandonado el territorio y la defensa de la vida y de la honra de los ciudadanos, hable con el juez de su municipio y pida que esos miembros de la fuerza pÃºblica que hoy se arrodillan y violan la ConstituciÃ³n, tengan que actuar en su defensaâ€.
AcompaÃ±ando el video, el excandidato presidencial asegurÃ³ que: â€œPetro estÃ¡ entregando el paÃ­s a los violentos y a los corruptos, formando y definiendo una alianza con los peores dictadores de la tierra como Maduro, Putin y los Castroâ€.
El inicio de una dictadura por parte de Gustavo Petro, seÃ±ala GÃ³mez, â€œes negarse a acatar la suspensiÃ³n del Canciller Leyva e impedir que la fuerza pÃºblica proteja la vida, honra y bienes de los colombianosâ€.
En la misma lÃ­nea que Enrique GÃ³mez, el representante Miguel Polo Polo tambiÃ©n cuestionÃ³ la nominaciÃ³n al Nobel de Paz de Gustavo Petro:
â€œÂ¿En serio un nominado al Nobel de Paz que se alzÃ³ en armas y perteneciÃ³ a un grupo terrorista que matÃ³, secuestro y torturo miles de colombianos en los 80â€²s? Â¿En serio un nominado al Nobel de Paz que recibiÃ³ financiaciÃ³n del narcotrÃ¡fico para su campaÃ±a presidencial?â€, escribiÃ³ Polo Polo en su cuenta de X.

title: Arce foi avisado de tentativa de golpe, diz ministro
text:
O ministro do Interior da BolÃ­via, Eduardo del Castillo disse nesta 5Âª feira (27.jun.2024) Ã  emissora Unitel que o governo havia sido avisado de indÃ­cios de â€œtentativas de desestabilizaÃ§Ã£oâ€ antes da tentativa de golpe contra o presidente Luis Arce na 4Âª feira (26.mai). Os detalhes especÃ­ficos do plano eram desconhecidos.
Del Castillo afirmou que 17 pessoas foram presas por participaÃ§Ã£o na tentativa de golpe, incluindo o ex-comandante Juan JosÃ© ZÃºÃ±iga e o ex-comandante da Marinha, Juan Arnez Salvador. Estima-se que cerca de 200 militares participaram da aÃ§Ã£o.
FormulÃ¡rio de cadastro receba alertas grÃ¡tis do Poder360 quero receber por e-mail concordo com os termos da LGPD . quero receber no WhatsApp Inscreva-se quero receber no Telegram Inscreva-se ZÃºÃ±iga, principal figura por trÃ¡s da tentativa de golpe, tinha sido demitido de seu cargo na 3Âª feira (26.jun), depois de realizar criticas ao ex-presidente Evo Morales. Durante uma entrevista, afirmou que Morales nÃ£o poderia mais ocupar o cargo, declarando que nÃ£o permitiria que â€œa ConstituiÃ§Ã£o fosse pisoteada, que desobedecesse ao mandato do povoâ€ .
Apesar da ameaÃ§a culminar na destituiÃ§Ã£o do ex-comandante, o governo nÃ£o esperava que ZÃºÃ±iga fosse mobilizar o exÃ©rcito contra Arce. â€œ NinguÃ©m poderia imaginar que no dia seguinte, antes da transferÃªncia oficial dos cargos, haveria um golpe fracassado em nosso paÃ­s â€œ, declarou del Castillo.
ENTENDA O CASO Ã€s 15h57 (horÃ¡rio de BrasÃ­lia) de 4Âª feira (26.jun), o presidente da BolÃ­via, Luis Arce, anunciou a tentativa de golpe depois que veÃ­culos blindados e militares estacionaram nas esquinas da Plaza Murillo, onde fica o PalÃ¡cio Quemado, sede da PresidÃªncia boliviana, e a Assembleia Legislativa Plurinacional, na cidade de La Paz.
Assista (1min39s):
O movimento foi comandado pelo general Juan JosÃ© ZÃºÃ±iga , ex-comandante do ExÃ©rcito da BolÃ­via destituÃ­do na 3Âª feira (25.jun) depois de criticar o ex-presidente boliviano Evo Morales. A jornalistas, ZÃºÃ±iga disse que os militares buscavam â€œrestaurar a democraciaâ€ e pediu a liberaÃ§Ã£o imediata de presos polÃ­ticos.
Imagens divulgadas nas redes sociais mostraram o momento em que um tanque de guerra atingiu a entrada do palÃ¡cio presidencial em La Paz.
El levantamiento antidemocrÃ¡tico de algunas unidades del EjÃ©rcito de Bolivia, solo merecen el mÃ¡s enÃ©rgico repudio.
Mi respaldo incondicional al presidente Luis Arce y convoco a la defensa firme de la democracia. No permitamos que la voluntad del pueblo sea avasallada. Fuerzaâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/20lbVoCji4

Em outro registro, o presidente boliviano apareceu enfrentando o general ZÃºÃ±iga do lado de fora do palÃ¡cio.

Arce mudou o comando do ExÃ©rcito por causa da tentativa de golpe. Ao lado do presidente no PalÃ¡cio Quemado, o novo comandante, JosÃ© Wilson SÃ¡nchez, ordenou que as tropas recuassem. â€œPeÃ§o, ordeno que todo o pessoal que se encontra mobilizado deve voltar Ã s suas unidadesâ€ , declarou.
Por volta das 19h (horÃ¡rio de BrasÃ­lia) desta 4Âª feira (26.jun), os militares comeÃ§aram a deixar a PraÃ§a Murillo.
